Class BaseProjectManager

java.lang.Object
BaseProjectManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
I_ListOutProjects, I_ProjectManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProjectManager
public abstract class BaseProjectManager extends Object implements I_ProjectManager, I_ListOutProjects
BaseProjectManager is an abstract class that implements the I_ProjectManager and I_ListOutProjects interfaces. It provides a foundation for managing housing projects, including functionalities for listing, updating, and checking project details.

This class contains methods to manage projects, check their status, and print relevant information.

See Also:
  • I_ProjectManager
  • I_ListOutProjects

    • currentActiveProject

      public Project currentActiveProject(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String userName, boolean printCheck)
      Finds and returns the currently active project for the specified manager from a list of projects. An active project is defined as one where:
      • Under specific HDB manager's managed projects
      • The current date is within the project's application period
      • The project is visible
      Specified by:
      currentActiveProject in interface I_ProjectManager
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      userName - the name of the HDB manager to match (must not be null or empty)
      printCheck - flag to control whether to print status messages: - If true, prints active project details when found or "No Active Project" message when none found - If false, operates silently
      Returns:
      the currently active project if found, null otherwise
      See Also:
      • Project

    • returnProject

      public Project returnProject(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String projectName)
      Searches for and returns a specific project by its unique name from a list of projects.

      This method performs a linear search through the provided list of projects to find a project with a matching name (case-sensitive comparison). The project name serves as a unique identifier for this lookup operation.

      Specified by:
      returnProject in interface I_ProjectManager
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - The list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      projectName - The name of the project to find (case-sensitive, must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      The found Project object if exists, null if no matching project is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either currentProjects or projectName is null
      See Also:
      • Project.getProjectName()

    • listAllExistingProjects

      public void listAllExistingProjects(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects)
      Prints list of all existing projects with their details.
      Specified by:
      listAllExistingProjects in interface I_ListOutProjects
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to display (must not be null, but can be empty) The output format is as follows: 
       === List of All Existing Projects ===
 
 [Project 1 details - same format as listRequiredProjects]
 [Project 2 details]
 ...
 
 Total Projects: [count]
 ===============================
      Example output: 
       === List of All Existing Projects ===
 
 Project Name: Sunshine Residences | Neighborhood: Tampines | Visibility: true
    - Flat Details:
       - Flat Type: 3-Room, Units: 150, Price: $300000.00
       - Flat Type: 4-Room, Units: 100, Price: $400000.00
    - Application Period: Mon Jan 01 00:00:00 SGT 2024 to Fri Jan 12 23:59:59 SGT 2024
    - HDB Manager: John Tan
    - Available HDB Officer Slots: 2
    - HDB Officer In-Charge: Sarah Lim Michael Wong
 
 Total Projects: 1
 ===============================

    • listSpecificProjects

      public void listSpecificProjects(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String username)
      Prints list of projects managed by a specific HDB manager.

      This method displays all projects where the specified user is the assigned HDB manager, including complete project details and a total count of matching projects.

      Specified by:
      listSpecificProjects in interface I_ListOutProjects
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to filter through (must not be null, but can be empty)
      username - the name of the HDB manager to filter by (case-sensitive, must not be null or empty) The output includes: 
       === List of All Your Existing Projects ===
 
 [Project details for manager's projects - same format as listRequiredProjects]
 ...
 
 Total Projects: [count]
 ===============================

    • toggleVisibility

      public void toggleVisibility(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String projectName, String username)
      Toggles the visibility status of a specified project and updates both the runtime list and storage.

      This method performs the following operations:

      1. Locates the project by name in the provided list
      2. Inverts the current visibility status (ON to OFF or OFF to ON)
      3. Updates the project's visibility in the ProjectList.txt file
      4. Updates the runtime Project object
      Specified by:
      toggleVisibility in interface I_ProjectManager
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null)
      projectName - the exact name of the project to modify (case-sensitive, must not be null or empty)
      username - The NRIC of the HDB Manager or Project Officer managing the project
      See Also:
      • General
      • Project

    • isWithinApplicationPeriod

      public boolean isWithinApplicationPeriod(ArrayList<Project> currentProjects, String projectName)
      Checks whether the specified project is within its application period.

      The method searches for a project with the given name in the provided project list and verifies if the current system time falls between the project's application opening and closing dates.

      Specified by:
      isWithinApplicationPeriod in interface I_ProjectManager
      Parameters:
      currentProjects - the list of projects to search through (must not be null or contain null elements)
      projectName - the name of the project to check (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      true if:
      • The project exists in the list
      • The current time is within application period
      false if:
      • The project is not found in the list
      • The current time is not within the application period
      See Also:
      • Project.getProjectName()
      • Project.getApplicationOpeningDate()
      • Project.getApplicationClosingDate()
